page.title: 08DOUNE CASTLE
page.content: Doune Castle was built in 1370 by Robert, Duke of Albany. It was restored between 1883 and 1886. Inside the door is a{guard house}which joins onto a prison, and across from them are two cellars. In the courtyard is a well 60 feet deep. Up some stairs is the{Lord's Hall.}Some stairs in the Lord's Hall lead to the bedrooms and the{Royal Apartments.}Some other stairs lead to the{Great Chamber,}the main living room. A staircase starting outside leads to the{Great Kitchen and {the Retainers' Hall.}Doune Castle was handed over to the Department of Environment (Ancient Monuments) in 1984. It has a huge amount of visitors every year. Outside, on the grassy mound is the site of the{Old Gallow's {Tree.
